question: 不考虑信用水平，找出 4个能说明 A B C 债券的息票额较低的原因，并说明理由
answers:
使得A B C债务更富吸引力的那些因素可以说明为什么它有一较低的息票率和到期收益率，那
些因素是：
a. A B C债务发行量更大，因而具有较好的流动性。
b. 如果1 0年后的利率低于今天的利率，期权的存在可以将债券期限从 1 0年延长至2 0年。相反，
如果利率上升，投资者可以将债券兑换回货币进行收益更好的投资。
c. 在发生困难时，A B C债务有优先偿债权。它是具有更好地对不动产进行索偿的

question: 为什么息票率为9%的商业票据的价格波动范围大于浮动利率的商业票据?

question: 简述为什么美国财政零息债券比同期限的有息债券的收益率高？
answers:
付息债券可视为剥离的零息债券的资产组合：每份息票可以单独作为一独立的零息债券存在。
因此，息票债券的收益率将反映每笔息票支付日的收益率情况。当收益率曲线向上倾斜，息票债券比具有相同期限的零息债券的收益率要小，因为付息债券的到期收益率将会反映较早时以及中期的息票支付。

question: 简述1996年到1999年资金周转率与财务杠杆的变化给股本收益率带来的影响
answers:
资产周转率衡量的是公司为了维持销售水平而减少资产规模(固定资产或流动资产)的能力。这段时期资产周转率有相当大的增幅，对ROE的增长有正面影响。
财务杠杆衡量的是融资，而不是股权的数量，包括长、短期债务。这段时期财务杠杆下降了，这对ROE有负面影响。由于资产周转率的上升幅度大于财务杠杆的下降幅度，所以对ROE的净效果是使其上升

question:
在下列情况下哪只股票是最佳选择?

ii. 这只股票将与投资者的其他债券资产组合混合，是目前市场指数基金的一个独立组成部 分。

answers:
i: A更好。
ii: B更好。
iii: B更好。

苏珊(Susan)是RI公司的总裁，RI公司是一家美国公司，它的销售全部都在国内，该公司的股票在纽约证券交易所上市。下面是有关它的现状的其他资料。
苏珊是一位58岁的独身者，她没有直系亲属，没有债务，也没有自有住宅。苏珊的健康状况良好，并且有IR公司持续支付她的在65岁退休后可获得的健康保险。她每年的薪水为500000美元(考虑通胀因素)，足够她维持现有的生活水平，但没有剩余可以储蓄。她早年有2000000美元的短期存款。IR公司通过“慷慨股票奖金”计划来激励其重要的员工，但不提供养老金计划和股利。苏珊参与这项激励计划使得她所持有的IR公司股票的价值达10000000美元(现值)。因为股票是免税的，但在出售时要支付的税率为35%(对全部收入)，所以苏珊的股票预计至少会持有到她退休时为止。她的当前支出水平和4%的通货膨胀率到她退休后预计仍保持不变。苏珊的薪水、投资收入和实现的资本利得所面临的税率为35%。假设她的复合税率永远都保持在这一平。苏珊的特性是对任何事情都耐心、细致与谨慎。她认为用自己的储蓄进行有价证券的投资在任何12个月内的名义跌幅不会超过10%时，每年税后有3%的回报率是完全可接受的。为了获得专业性的帮助，她接触了两个投资顾问公司—“HH顾问公司”和“海岸顾问公司”，以获得如何用她的既有储蓄资产进行投资组合配置的建议以及一般性投资的建议。

Susan is the president of RI, a U.S. company that sells all its sales in China, and its shares are listed on the New York Stock Exchange. Below are other information on its current status.

Susan is in good health and has IR companies that continue to pay for her health insurance available after she retires at the age of 65. Her annual salary is $500,000 (considering inflation), which is enough for her to maintain her current standard of living, but there is no surplus to save. IR companies motivate their important employees through the “Generous Stock Bonus” program, but do not offer pension plans and dividends. Susan's participation in this incentive program has brought the value of her IR shares to $1,000,000 (current value). Because the stock is tax-free, but the tax rate to be paid at a sale is 35% (total income), Susan's stock is expected to be held until at least until she retires. Her current spending levels and 4% inflation rate are expected to remain unchanged until she retires. Susan's salary, investment income and realized capital gains face a tax rate of 35%. Suppose her compound tax rate will always remain at this level. Susan's characteristic is to be patient, meticulous and cautious about everything. She believes that it is perfectly acceptable to have a 3% return after tax every year when the nominal decline of nominal decline in any 12-month period will not exceed 10%. To obtain professional help, she contacted two investment advisor companies - "HH Consultant Company" and "Coastal Advisor Company" to obtain advice on how to use her existing savings assets to make portfolio allocations and general investment advice.

苏珊是一位58岁的独身者，她没有直系亲属，没有债务，也没有自有住宅。苏珊的健康状况良好，并且有IR公司持续支付她的在65岁退休后可获得的健康保险。她每年的薪水为500000美元(考虑通胀因素)，足够她维持现有的生活水平，但没有剩余可以储蓄。她早年有2000000美元的短期存款。IR公司通过“慷慨股票奖金”计划来激励其重要的员工，但不提供养老金计划和股利。苏珊参与这项激励计划使得她所持有的IR公司股票的价值达10000000美元(现值)。因为股票是免税的，但在出售时要支付的税率为35%(对全部收入)，所以苏珊的股票预计至少会持有到她退休时为止。她的当前支出水平和4%的通货膨胀率到她退休后预计仍保持不变。苏珊的薪水、投资收入和实现的资本利得所面临的税率为35%。假设她的复合税率永远都保持在这一平。苏珊的特性是对任何事情都耐心、细致与谨慎。她认为用自己的储蓄进行有价证券的投资在任何12个月内的名义跌幅不会超过10%时，每年税后有3%的回报率是完全可接受的。为了获得专业性的帮助，她接触了两个投资顾问公司—“HH顾问公司”和“海岸顾问公司”，以获得如何用她的既有储蓄资产进行投资组合配置的建议以及一般性投资的建议。

translate_question: Find an asset allocation plan that meets or exceeds Susan’s proposed earnings targets.
translate_context:
Susan is the president of RI, a U.S. company that sells all its sales in China, and its shares are listed on the New York Stock Exchange. Below are other information on its current status.
Susan is a 58-year-old celibate who has no immediate family, no debts, and no home. Susan is in good health and has IR companies that continue to pay for her health insurance available after she retires at the age of 65. Her annual salary is $500,000 (considering inflation), which is enough for her to maintain her current standard of living, but there is no surplus to save. She had a short-term deposit of $2,000,000 in her early years. IR companies motivate their important employees through the “Generous Stock Bonus” program, but do not offer pension plans and dividends. Susan's participation in this incentive program has brought the value of her IR shares to $1,000,000 (current value). Because the stock is tax-free, but the tax rate to be paid at a sale is 35% (total income), Susan's stock is expected to be held until at least until she retires. Her current spending levels and 4% inflation rate are expected to remain unchanged until she retires. Susan's salary, investment income and realized capital gains face a tax rate of 35%. Suppose her compound tax rate will always remain at this level. Susan's characteristic is to be patient, meticulous and cautious about everything. She believes that it is perfectly acceptable to have a 3% return after tax every year when the nominal decline of nominal decline in any 12-month period will not exceed 10%. To obtain professional help, she contacted two investment advisor companies - "HH Consultant Company" and "Coastal Advisor Company" to obtain advice on how to use her existing savings assets to make portfolio allocations and general investment advice.
"HH" company provides customers with five optional asset allocation plans, see Table <image_1>. context:
Goldsboro Partners是一家投资管理公司，计划提供更多投资于新加坡交易所（SGX）上市股票的产品。

Goldsboro正在开发Goldsboro新加坡指数（GSI）；这是一个专有指数，由新加坡交易所上市的市值最大的五只股票组成。
Goldsboro需要决定如何构建GSI。这些公司的股价和市值信息见表1。
<image_1>

Goldsboro有四个大型机构客户表示，他们可能会在一只追踪GSI的基金中投资总计2.4亿美元。这些客户对成本非常敏感。

Goldsboro目前已经提供两只由海峡时报指数（STI）成分股组成的共同基金，STI是一个由新加坡交易所上市的30家最大公司组成的市值加权指数。表2提供了这两只基金（GB1和GB2）、STI指数以及新加坡交易所所有上市股票的相关信息。

<image_2>
<image_3>

Goldsboro还提供三只独立管理的基金：GB-STI-1、GB-STI-2和GB-STI-3。这三只基金都以STI指数为基准。在2009年，客户Jason Briggs（其新加坡基准为MSCI新加坡自由指数）采用核心卫星投资策略投资这三只基金，获得了12.4%的回报。这三只基金的信息、回报率和Briggs的投资情况见表3。

2009年，MSCI新加坡自由指数的回报率为11.7%，STI指数的回报率为12.0%。

<image_4> /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 附表1：新加坡五大企业：以美元计的相关信息 2009年 2010年 2009年1 2010年1 公司 1月1日 1月1日 价格变 月1日市值 月1日市值 市值变 动 （十亿美 （十亿美 价格 价格 动 元） 元） 新电信 2.35 2.53 +7.7% 48.5 52.5 +8.2% (SingTel) 丰益国际 5.77 6.80 +17.9% 32.7 41.2 +26.0% (Wilmar) 星展银行（DBS 11.62 13.28 +14.3% 26.6 30.1 +13.2% Group) 怡和控股 (Jardine 23.94 26.71 +11.6% 25.3 27.6 +9.1% Matheson) 大华银行 12.73 14.07 +10.5% 23.9 26.8 +12.1% (UOB) 总计 56.41 63.39 157.0 178.2/nimage_2 ocr text: 附表2：Goldsboro的两只基金、STI和SGX的比较 指标 基金GB1 基金GB2 STI SGX 股票数量 12 12 30 612 平均市值 USD12.4billion USD13.2billion USD13.7billion USD2.7billion 股息收益率 1.5% 2.1% 1.6% 0.8% 市盈率（P/E） 21.7 16.8 21.4 24.7/nimage_3 ocr text: 附表2（续）：Goldsboro的两只基金、STI和SGX的比较 指标 基金GB1 基金GB2 STI SGX 市净率（P/B） 2.6 2.1 2.7 2.9 预期每股收益增长率（EPS） 11.0% 8.4% 11.2% 13.7%/nimage_4 ocr text: 附表3：Briggs在以STi为基准的Goldsboro基金中的投资情况 指标 GB-STI-1 GB-STI-2 GB-STI-3 基金预期超额收益（Alpha） 5% 2% 0% 基金预期跟踪误差 9% 5% 0% Briggs的投资金额 USD20million USD20million USD10million 2009年回报率 15% 10% 12%</ocr>
question: 根据表1数据，在2009年期间，假设指数成分股没有发生股票分割或派发股票股利且无需再平衡的情况下，以下哪种指数结构最可能为GSI带来最高回报？
translate_question: According to Table 1 data, which of the following index structures are most likely to bring the highest returns to GSI during the 2009 period assuming that there is no stock split or dividend distribution in the index component stocks and no rebalancing is required?
translate_context:
Goldsboro Partners is an investment management company that plans to provide more products to invest in listed stocks on the Singapore Exchange (SGX).

Goldsboro is developing the Goldsboro Singapore Index (GSI); a proprietary index consisting of five stocks with the largest market capitalization listed on the Singapore Exchange.
Goldsboro needs to decide how to build a GSI. The stock price and market value information of these companies are shown in Table 1.
<image_1>

Goldsboro has four large institutional clients that say they may invest a total of $240 million in a fund that tracks GSI. These customers are very cost-sensitive.

Goldsboro has now provided two mutual funds composed of components of the Straits Times Index (STI), a market value-weighted index of 30 largest companies listed on the Singapore Exchange. Table 2 provides information about these two funds (GB1 and GB2), STI index and all listed stocks on the Singapore Exchange.

<image_2>
<image_3>

Goldsboro also offers three independently managed funds: GB-STI-1, GB-STI-2 and GB-STI-3. All three funds are based on the STI index. In 2009, client Jason Briggs (whose Singapore benchmark is MSCI Singapore Free Index) used a core satellite investment strategy to invest in these three funds, earning a 12.4% return. The information, return rate and investment status of these three funds are shown in Table 3.

In 2009, the MSCI Singapore Free Index had a return of 11.7% and the STI Index had a return of 12.0%.

<image_4> /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Schedule 1: Singapore's top five companies: Related information in USD 2009 2010 2009 1 January 2010 Company January 1 January 1 Price Change Monthly Market Value Market Value Change Monthly Market Value Change Monthly Market Value (US$1 billion (US$1 billion Price Price Moment) RMB) New Telecom 2.35 2.53 +7.7% 48.5 52.5 +8.2% (SingTel) Fengyi International 5.77 6.80 +17.9% 32.7 41.2 +26.0% (Wilmar) DBS Bank (DBS 11.62 13.28 +14.3% 26.6 30.1 +13.2% Group) Jardine Holdings (Jardine 23.94 26.71 +11.6% 25.3 27.6 +9.1% Matheson) UOB 12.73 14.07 +10.5% 23.9 26.8 +12.1% (UOB) Total 56.41 63.39 157.0 178.2/nimage_2 ocr text: Schedule 2: Comparison between two funds, STI and SGX in Goldsboro Indicators Fund GB1 Fund GB2 STI SGX Number of stocks 12 12 30 612 Average Market Cap USD12.4billion USD13.2billion USD13.7billion USD2.7billion Dividend yield 1.5% 2.1% 1.6% 0.8% P/E ratio (P/E) 21.7 16.8 21.4 24.7/nimage_3 ocr text: Schedule 2 (continued): Comparison between Goldsboro's two funds, STI and SGX Indicators Fund GB1 Fund GB2 STI SGX Price/B ratio (P/B) 2.6 2.1 2.7 2.9 Expected EPS growth rate (EPS) 11.0% 8.4% 11.2% 13.7%/nimage_4 ocr text: Schedule 3: Briggs' investment in Goldsboro funds based on STi Indicators GB-STI-1 GB-STI-2 GB-STI-3 Fund Expected Excess Return (Alpha) 5% 2% 0% Fund Expected Tracking Error 9% 5% 0% Briggs' investment amount USD20million USD20million USD10million 2009 Return 15% 10% 12%</ocr>

Goldsboro还提供三只独立管理的基金：GB-STI-1、GB-STI-2和GB-STI-3。这三只基金都以STI指数为基准。在2009年，客户Jason Briggs（其新加坡基准为MSCI新加坡自由指数）采用核心卫星投资策略投资这三只基金，获得了12.4%的回报。这三只基金的信息、回报率和Briggs的投资情况见表3。

2009年，MSCI新加坡自由指数的回报率为11.7%，STI指数的回报率为12.0%。

question: 将Briggs的投资特征定义为核心卫星投资策略这一说法最可能是
options: B. 错误，因为投资组合中被动投资的比例过低

translate_question: The statement that the investment characteristics of Briggs are defined as core satellite investment strategies is most likely
translate_context:
Goldsboro Partners is an investment management company that plans to provide more products to invest in listed stocks on the Singapore Exchange (SGX).

Goldsboro is developing the Goldsboro Singapore Index (GSI); a proprietary index consisting of five stocks with the largest market capitalization listed on the Singapore Exchange.
Goldsboro needs to decide how to build a GSI. The stock price and market value information of these companies are shown in Table 1.
<image_1>

Goldsboro has four large institutional clients that say they may invest a total of $240 million in a fund that tracks GSI. These customers are very cost-sensitive.

Goldsboro has now provided two mutual funds composed of components of the Straits Times Index (STI), a market value-weighted index of 30 largest companies listed on the Singapore Exchange. Table 2 provides information about these two funds (GB1 and GB2), STI index and all listed stocks on the Singapore Exchange.

<image_2>
<image_3>

Goldsboro also offers three independently managed funds: GB-STI-1, GB-STI-2 and GB-STI-3. All three funds are based on the STI index. In 2009, client Jason Briggs (whose Singapore benchmark is MSCI Singapore Free Index) used a core satellite investment strategy to invest in these three funds, earning a 12.4% return. The information, return rate and investment status of these three funds are shown in Table 3.

In 2009, the MSCI Singapore Free Index had a return of 11.7% and the STI Index had a return of 12.0%.

context:
伦敦的Kingsbridge Partners被选中管理一个价值1.5亿英镑的全球债券投资组合，服务于一个养老基金。Kingsbridge的投资组合经理Jonathan Bixby与公司固定收益分析师Iain Seymour会面，审查投资组合及其持仓是否符合客户目标。

养老基金允许使用100%杠杆来产生额外收益。Bixby使用表1中的数据评估投资组合中的杠杆使用情况。
<image_1>
Bixby当前的宏观观点认为经济增长率高于趋势水平，因此利率可能会上升。基于这一观点，他担心投资组合的久期不合适，计划使用期货市场来管理利率风险。他为资产组合设定的新久期目标是4.25，并使用表2中的数据来调整投资组合。
<image_2>
Seymour向Bixby建议，作为期货的替代方案，他可以使用利率互换或期权来改变投资组合的久期。他说可以通过收取固定利率并支付浮动利率的互换来调整久期。Seymour还建议，购买保护性看跌期权可以实现对冲目标，而且如果Bixby对未来利率走向的判断错误，还能提供更多上涨空间。他说Bixby也可以通过卖出备兑看涨期权来表达他的观点，且不需要支付期权费。

Seymour告诉Bixby："国际利率之间并非完全相关。我们可以看到美国利率变化对我们模型全球债券组合的影响。这个投资组合包含美国和德国债券，目前未就货币或利率进行对冲。我们的分析显示，美国和德国之间的国家贝塔系数为0.62。"模型全球债券组合数据在表3中提供。
<image_3>
Bixby询问Seymour该模型组合是否应该对冲回本国货币英镑。Bixby告诉他，积极管理货币风险是投资组合获取额外收益的预期来源，历史上占Kingsbridge相对于基准alpha的25%。Seymour参考表4的数据来支持他当前认为应该积极管理投资组合货币敞口的观点。
<image_4>
Bixby询问这个全球投资组合是否会受益于包含新兴市场债券。Seymour回应说，在某些时期新兴市场的收益可能很有吸引力，但风险也很多。他指出以下风险：
风险1：收益经常表现出显著的负偏度，因为潜在的巨大下行风险无法被相应的上行空间所抵消。
风险2：与发达国家相比，新兴市场对行政部门干预的防护较弱。
风险3：新兴市场国家获取二级流动性来源的能力有限。 /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 附表1：资产与负债 项目 资产（GBP百万） 负债（GBP百万） 投资组合（Portfolio） 300 150 久期（Duration） 5.50 1.00 预期回报或成本（ExpectedReturnorCost，%） 4.75 3.95/nimage_2 ocr text: 附表2：期货市场数据 项目 数据 期货合约价格（FuturesContractPrice） GBP100,500 转换因子（ConversionFactor） 1.12 最便宜可交割债券的久期（DurationofCheapesttoDeliverBond） 5.3 最便宜可交割债券的价格（PriceofCheapesttoDeliverBond） GBP97,750/nimage_3 ocr text: 附表3：全球债券模型组合 债券发行人 久期（Duration） 配置比例（Allocation，%) 美国债券发行人（USBondIssuers） 6.6 60 德国债券发行人（GermanBondIssuers） 3.9 40/nimage_4 ocr text: 附表4：外汇市场数据 美国（United 欧元区 英国（United 项目 States) (Eurozone) Kingdom) 无风险利率-一年（RiskFreeRate- OneYear) 0.25% 1.50% 0.90% 即期汇率（SpotRate，GBPperUSDor 0.6098 0.8929 EUR) 一 远期汇率（ForwardRate，GBPperUSD 0.6137 0.8875 一 orEUR) Kingsbridge对一年后即期汇率的预测 KingsbridgeForecastSpotRatein1 0.6173 0.8850 Year)</ocr>
question: 基于表1的数据，杠杆投资组合的权益久期最接近：
translate_question: Based on the data in Table 1, the equity duration of the leveraged portfolio is closest:
translate_context:
Kingsbridge Partners in London were selected to manage a £150 million global bond portfolio that serves a pension fund. Jonathan Bixby, portfolio manager at Kingsbridge, met with Iain Seymour, a firm income analyst, to review whether the portfolio and its holdings meet client goals.

Pension funds allow the use of 100% leverage to generate additional benefits. Bixby uses the data from Table 1 to evaluate leverage usage in the portfolio.
<image_1>
Bixby's current macro perspective is that economic growth is higher than the trend level, so interest rates may rise. Based on this view, he was worried that the portfolio’s duration was inappropriate and planned to use the futures market to manage interest rate risks. His new duration target for the portfolio is 4.25 and uses the data in Table 2 to adjust the portfolio.
<image_2>
Seymour suggested to Bixby that as an alternative to futures, he could use interest rate swaps or options to change the duration of his portfolio. He said the duration can be adjusted by charging fixed interest rates and paying swaps for floating interest rates. Seymour also suggests that buying protective put options can achieve hedging goals, and that if Bixby misjudgment on future interest rate trends, it can provide more room for upside. He said Bixby could also express his views by selling a backup call option without paying the option fee.

"International interest rates are not completely related. We can see the impact of changes in U.S. interest rates on our model's global bond portfolio. This portfolio contains U.S. and German bonds and currently has no hedging for currencies or interest rates. Our analysis shows that the national beta coefficient between the U.S. and Germany is 0.62." The model's global bond portfolio data are provided in Table 3.
<image_3>
Bixby asked Seymour if the model combination should hedge back to the home currency pound. Bixby told him that actively managing currency risk is an expected source of additional returns for portfolios, historically accounting for 25% of Kingsbridge's relative to the benchmark alpha. Seymour refers to the data from Table 4 to support his current view that portfolio currency exposure should be actively managed.
<image_4>
Bixby asked if this global portfolio would benefit from the inclusion of emerging market bonds. Seymour responded that emerging market earnings may be attractive in some periods, but there are many risks. He pointed out the following risks:
Risk 1: Returns often show significant negative skewness, because the potential huge downside risk cannot be offset by the corresponding upside space.
Risk 2: Compared with developed countries, emerging markets have weak protection from administrative intervention.
Risk 3: Emerging market countries have limited ability to obtain secondary liquidity sources. /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Attachment 1: Assets and Liabilities Item Assets (GBP million) Liabilities (GBP million) Portfolio (Portfolio) 300 150 Duration 5.50 1.00 Expected Return or Cost (Expected Return Cost, %) 4.75 3.95/nimage_2 ocr text: Attachment 2: Futures Market Data Item Data Futures Contract Price GBP100,500 Conversion Factor 1.12 Duration of Cheapest to DeliverBond 5.3 Price of Cheapest to DeliverBond GBP97,750/nimage_3 ocr text: Schedule 3: Global Bond Model Portfolio Bond Issuers Duration Allocation Proportion (Allocation, %) US Bond Issuers 6.6 60 German Bond Issuers 3.9 40/nimage_4 ocr text: Schedule 4: Forex Market Data United States (United Eurozone) United Kingdom Risk-free Rate-One Year (RiskFreeRate-One Year) 0.25% 1.50% 0.90% Spot exchange rate (SpotRate, GBPperUSDor 0.6098 0.8929 EUR) 1 Forward exchange rate (ForwardRate, GBPperUSD 0.6137 0.8875 1 or EUR) Kingsbridge's forecast for spot exchange rate in one year KingsbridgeForecastSpotRatein1 0.6173 0.8850 Year)</ocr>

question: 基于Bixby的新目标久期和表1、2中的数据，使用国债期货最合适的操作是卖出：
translate_question: Based on Bixby's new target duration and the data in Tables 1 and 2, the most suitable operation to use Treasury futures is to sell:
translate_context:
Kingsbridge Partners in London were selected to manage a £150 million global bond portfolio that serves a pension fund. Jonathan Bixby, portfolio manager at Kingsbridge, met with Iain Seymour, a firm income analyst, to review whether the portfolio and its holdings meet client goals.

Pension funds allow the use of 100% leverage to generate additional benefits. Bixby uses the data from Table 1 to evaluate leverage usage in the portfolio.
<image_1>
Bixby's current macro perspective is that economic growth is higher than the trend level, so interest rates may rise. Based on this view, he was worried that the portfolio’s duration was inappropriate and planned to use the futures market to manage interest rate risks. His new duration target for the portfolio is 4.25 and uses the data in Table 2 to adjust the portfolio.
<image_2>
Seymour suggested to Bixby that as an alternative to futures, he could use interest rate swaps or options to change the duration of his portfolio. He said the duration can be adjusted by charging fixed interest rates and paying swaps for floating interest rates. Seymour also suggests that buying protective put options can achieve hedging goals, and that if Bixby misjudgment on future interest rate trends, it can provide more room for upside. He said Bixby could also express his views by selling a backup call option without paying the option fee.

"International interest rates are not completely related. We can see the impact of changes in U.S. interest rates on our model's global bond portfolio. This portfolio contains U.S. and German bonds and currently has no hedging for currencies or interest rates. Our analysis shows that the national beta coefficient between the U.S. and Germany is 0.62." The model's global bond portfolio data are provided in Table 3.
<image_3>
Bixby asked Seymour if the model combination should hedge back to the home currency pound. Bixby told him that actively managing currency risk is an expected source of additional returns for portfolios, historically accounting for 25% of Kingsbridge's relative to the benchmark alpha. Seymour refers to the data from Table 4 to support his current view that portfolio currency exposure should be actively managed.
<image_4>
Bixby asked if this global portfolio would benefit from the inclusion of emerging market bonds. Seymour responded that emerging market earnings may be attractive in some periods, but there are many risks. He pointed out the following risks:
Risk 1: Returns often show significant negative skewness, because the potential huge downside risk cannot be offset by the corresponding upside space.
Risk 2: Compared with developed countries, emerging markets have weak protection from administrative intervention.
Risk 3: Emerging market countries have limited ability to obtain secondary liquidity sources. /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Attachment 1: Assets and Liabilities Item Assets (GBP million) Liabilities (GBP million) Portfolio (Portfolio) 300 150 Duration 5.50 1.00 Expected Return or Cost (Expected Return Cost, %) 4.75 3.95/nimage_2 ocr text: Attachment 2: Futures Market Data Item Data Futures Contract Price GBP100,500 Conversion Factor 1.12 Duration of Cheapest to DeliverBond 5.3 Price of Cheapest to DeliverBond GBP97,750/nimage_3 ocr text: Schedule 3: Global Bond Model Portfolio Bond Issuers Duration Allocation Proportion (Allocation, %) US Bond Issuers 6.6 60 German Bond Issuers 3.9 40/nimage_4 ocr text: Schedule 4: Forex Market Data United States (United Eurozone) United Kingdom Risk-free Rate-One Year (RiskFreeRate-One Year) 0.25% 1.50% 0.90% Spot exchange rate (SpotRate, GBPperUSDor 0.6098 0.8929 EUR) 1 Forward exchange rate (ForwardRate, GBPperUSD 0.6137 0.8875 1 or EUR) Kingsbridge's forecast for spot exchange rate in one year KingsbridgeForecastSpotRatein1 0.6173 0.8850 Year)</ocr>

context:
伦敦的Kingsbridge Partners被选中管理一个价值1.5亿英镑的全球债券投资组合，服务于一个养老基金。Kingsbridge的投资组合经理Jonathan Bixby与公司固定收益分析师Iain Seymour会面，审查投资组合及其持仓是否符合客户目标。

养老基金允许使用100%杠杆来产生额外收益。Bixby使用表1中的数据评估投资组合中的杠杆使用情况。
<image_1>
Bixby当前的宏观观点认为经济增长率高于趋势水平，因此利率可能会上升。基于这一观点，他担心投资组合的久期不合适，计划使用期货市场来管理利率风险。他为资产组合设定的新久期目标是4.25，并使用表2中的数据来调整投资组合。
<image_2>
Seymour向Bixby建议，作为期货的替代方案，他可以使用利率互换或期权来改变投资组合的久期。他说可以通过收取固定利率并支付浮动利率的互换来调整久期。Seymour还建议，购买保护性看跌期权可以实现对冲目标，而且如果Bixby对未来利率走向的判断错误，还能提供更多上涨空间。他说Bixby也可以通过卖出备兑看涨期权来表达他的观点，且不需要支付期权费。

Seymour告诉Bixby："国际利率之间并非完全相关。我们可以看到美国利率变化对我们模型全球债券组合的影响。这个投资组合包含美国和德国债券，目前未就货币或利率进行对冲。我们的分析显示，美国和德国之间的国家贝塔系数为0.62。"模型全球债券组合数据在表3中提供。
<image_3>
Bixby询问Seymour该模型组合是否应该对冲回本国货币英镑。Bixby告诉他，积极管理货币风险是投资组合获取额外收益的预期来源，历史上占Kingsbridge相对于基准alpha的25%。Seymour参考表4的数据来支持他当前认为应该积极管理投资组合货币敞口的观点。
<image_4>
Bixby询问这个全球投资组合是否会受益于包含新兴市场债券。Seymour回应说，在某些时期新兴市场的收益可能很有吸引力，但风险也很多。他指出以下风险：
风险1：收益经常表现出显著的负偏度，因为潜在的巨大下行风险无法被相应的上行空间所抵消。
风险2：与发达国家相比，新兴市场对行政部门干预的防护较弱。
风险3：新兴市场国家获取二级流动性来源的能力有限。 /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 附表1：资产与负债 项目 资产（GBP百万） 负债（GBP百万） 投资组合（Portfolio） 300 150 久期（Duration） 5.50 1.00 预期回报或成本（ExpectedReturnorCost，%） 4.75 3.95/nimage_2 ocr text: 附表2：期货市场数据 项目 数据 期货合约价格（FuturesContractPrice） GBP100,500 转换因子（ConversionFactor） 1.12 最便宜可交割债券的久期（DurationofCheapesttoDeliverBond） 5.3 最便宜可交割债券的价格（PriceofCheapesttoDeliverBond） GBP97,750/nimage_3 ocr text: 附表3：全球债券模型组合 债券发行人 久期（Duration） 配置比例（Allocation，%) 美国债券发行人（USBondIssuers） 6.6 60 德国债券发行人（GermanBondIssuers） 3.9 40/nimage_4 ocr text: 附表4：外汇市场数据 美国（United 欧元区 英国（United 项目 States) (Eurozone) Kingdom) 无风险利率-一年（RiskFreeRate- OneYear) 0.25% 1.50% 0.90% 即期汇率（SpotRate，GBPperUSDor 0.6098 0.8929 EUR) 一 远期汇率（ForwardRate，GBPperUSD 0.6137 0.8875 一 orEUR) Kingsbridge对一年后即期汇率的预测 KingsbridgeForecastSpotRatein1 0.6173 0.8850 Year)</ocr>

question: 基于表4中的数据，Kingsbridge在货币远期市场上积极管理投资组合货币敞口最可能采取的行动是：
options: A. 卖出美元并买入欧元
B. 卖出欧元并买入美元
C. 卖出美元、卖出欧元并买入英镑
translate_question: Based on the data in Table 4, the most likely action that Kingsbridge actively manages portfolio currency exposure in the currency forward market is:
translate_context:
Kingsbridge Partners in London were selected to manage a £150 million global bond portfolio that serves a pension fund. Jonathan Bixby, portfolio manager at Kingsbridge, met with Iain Seymour, a firm income analyst, to review whether the portfolio and its holdings meet client goals.

Pension funds allow the use of 100% leverage to generate additional benefits. Bixby uses the data from Table 1 to evaluate leverage usage in the portfolio.
<image_1>
Bixby's current macro perspective is that economic growth is higher than the trend level, so interest rates may rise. Based on this view, he was worried that the portfolio’s duration was inappropriate and planned to use the futures market to manage interest rate risks. His new duration target for the portfolio is 4.25 and uses the data in Table 2 to adjust the portfolio.
<image_2>
Seymour suggested to Bixby that as an alternative to futures, he could use interest rate swaps or options to change the duration of his portfolio. He said the duration can be adjusted by charging fixed interest rates and paying swaps for floating interest rates. Seymour also suggests that buying protective put options can achieve hedging goals, and that if Bixby misjudgment on future interest rate trends, it can provide more room for upside. He said Bixby could also express his views by selling a backup call option without paying the option fee.

"International interest rates are not completely related. We can see the impact of changes in U.S. interest rates on our model's global bond portfolio. This portfolio contains U.S. and German bonds and currently has no hedging for currencies or interest rates. Our analysis shows that the national beta coefficient between the U.S. and Germany is 0.62." The model's global bond portfolio data are provided in Table 3.
<image_3>
Bixby asked Seymour if the model combination should hedge back to the home currency pound. Bixby told him that actively managing currency risk is an expected source of additional returns for portfolios, historically accounting for 25% of Kingsbridge's relative to the benchmark alpha. Seymour refers to the data from Table 4 to support his current view that portfolio currency exposure should be actively managed.
<image_4>
Bixby asked if this global portfolio would benefit from the inclusion of emerging market bonds. Seymour responded that emerging market earnings may be attractive in some periods, but there are many risks. He pointed out the following risks:
Risk 1: Returns often show significant negative skewness, because the potential huge downside risk cannot be offset by the corresponding upside space.
Risk 2: Compared with developed countries, emerging markets have weak protection from administrative intervention.
Risk 3: Emerging market countries have limited ability to obtain secondary liquidity sources. /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Attachment 1: Assets and Liabilities Item Assets (GBP million) Liabilities (GBP million) Portfolio (Portfolio) 300 150 Duration 5.50 1.00 Expected Return or Cost (Expected Return Cost, %) 4.75 3.95/nimage_2 ocr text: Attachment 2: Futures Market Data Item Data Futures Contract Price GBP100,500 Conversion Factor 1.12 Duration of Cheapest to DeliverBond 5.3 Price of Cheapest to DeliverBond GBP97,750/nimage_3 ocr text: Schedule 3: Global Bond Model Portfolio Bond Issuers Duration Allocation Proportion (Allocation, %) US Bond Issuers 6.6 60 German Bond Issuers 3.9 40/nimage_4 ocr text: Schedule 4: Forex Market Data United States (United Eurozone) United Kingdom Risk-free Rate-One Year (RiskFreeRate-One Year) 0.25% 1.50% 0.90% Spot exchange rate (SpotRate, GBPperUSDor 0.6098 0.8929 EUR) 1 Forward exchange rate (ForwardRate, GBPperUSD 0.6137 0.8875 1 or EUR) Kingsbridge's forecast for spot exchange rate in one year KingsbridgeForecastSpotRatein1 0.6173 0.8850 Year)</ocr>

context:
伦敦的Kingsbridge Partners被选中管理一个价值1.5亿英镑的全球债券投资组合，服务于一个养老基金。Kingsbridge的投资组合经理Jonathan Bixby与公司固定收益分析师Iain Seymour会面，审查投资组合及其持仓是否符合客户目标。

养老基金允许使用100%杠杆来产生额外收益。Bixby使用表1中的数据评估投资组合中的杠杆使用情况。
<image_1>
Bixby当前的宏观观点认为经济增长率高于趋势水平，因此利率可能会上升。基于这一观点，他担心投资组合的久期不合适，计划使用期货市场来管理利率风险。他为资产组合设定的新久期目标是4.25，并使用表2中的数据来调整投资组合。
<image_2>
Seymour向Bixby建议，作为期货的替代方案，他可以使用利率互换或期权来改变投资组合的久期。他说可以通过收取固定利率并支付浮动利率的互换来调整久期。Seymour还建议，购买保护性看跌期权可以实现对冲目标，而且如果Bixby对未来利率走向的判断错误，还能提供更多上涨空间。他说Bixby也可以通过卖出备兑看涨期权来表达他的观点，且不需要支付期权费。

Seymour告诉Bixby："国际利率之间并非完全相关。我们可以看到美国利率变化对我们模型全球债券组合的影响。这个投资组合包含美国和德国债券，目前未就货币或利率进行对冲。我们的分析显示，美国和德国之间的国家贝塔系数为0.62。"模型全球债券组合数据在表3中提供。
<image_3>
Bixby询问Seymour该模型组合是否应该对冲回本国货币英镑。Bixby告诉他，积极管理货币风险是投资组合获取额外收益的预期来源，历史上占Kingsbridge相对于基准alpha的25%。Seymour参考表4的数据来支持他当前认为应该积极管理投资组合货币敞口的观点。
<image_4>
Bixby询问这个全球投资组合是否会受益于包含新兴市场债券。Seymour回应说，在某些时期新兴市场的收益可能很有吸引力，但风险也很多。他指出以下风险：
风险1：收益经常表现出显著的负偏度，因为潜在的巨大下行风险无法被相应的上行空间所抵消。
风险2：与发达国家相比，新兴市场对行政部门干预的防护较弱。
风险3：新兴市场国家获取二级流动性来源的能力有限。 /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 附表1：资产与负债 项目 资产（GBP百万） 负债（GBP百万） 投资组合（Portfolio） 300 150 久期（Duration） 5.50 1.00 预期回报或成本（ExpectedReturnorCost，%） 4.75 3.95/nimage_2 ocr text: 附表2：期货市场数据 项目 数据 期货合约价格（FuturesContractPrice） GBP100,500 转换因子（ConversionFactor） 1.12 最便宜可交割债券的久期（DurationofCheapesttoDeliverBond） 5.3 最便宜可交割债券的价格（PriceofCheapesttoDeliverBond） GBP97,750/nimage_3 ocr text: 附表3：全球债券模型组合 债券发行人 久期（Duration） 配置比例（Allocation，%) 美国债券发行人（USBondIssuers） 6.6 60 德国债券发行人（GermanBondIssuers） 3.9 40/nimage_4 ocr text: 附表4：外汇市场数据 美国（United 欧元区 英国（United 项目 States) (Eurozone) Kingdom) 无风险利率-一年（RiskFreeRate- OneYear) 0.25% 1.50% 0.90% 即期汇率（SpotRate，GBPperUSDor 0.6098 0.8929 EUR) 一 远期汇率（ForwardRate，GBPperUSD 0.6137 0.8875 一 orEUR) Kingsbridge对一年后即期汇率的预测 KingsbridgeForecastSpotRatein1 0.6173 0.8850 Year)</ocr>

context:
Nadia Ahmed是位于英国伦敦的Tweed资产管理公司(Tweed)的首席交易员。她正在审查交易台收到的来自个人和机构投资组合经理的交易请求，并决定推荐什么交易策略。
Ahmed首先审查来自Tweed个人投资组合经理Edwin Moore的交易请求。她将这些请求转交给公司的交易员Vladimir Norsk。Ahmed要求Norsk执行的第一笔交易是购买2,000股BDF有限公司的股票，该股票在伦敦不常交易股票的交易商市场SEAQ上交易。Norsk查看了BDF当前的限价订单簿，如表1所示。
<image_1>
Norsk在当天通过执行表2所示的交易完成了BDF的订单。
<image_2>
接下来Ahmed审查的是一位对价格执行非常关注的客户要求购买300,000股WWT plc的请求。她查看了前一天的交易量（表3），并准备她的交易建议。
<image_3>
Ahmed要求Norsk执行的Moore的最后一个订单是以25.00英镑的限价购买1,000股JAK plc的股票，订单有效期为当天。

Norsk在第一天未能完成限价订单，经与客户协商后他们同意修改价格。两天后，Norsk以26.25英镑的价格成功购买了800股JAK，佣金成本为135.00英镑。当天股票收盘价为26.75英镑时，Moore决定取消剩余200股的订单。

Moore和Ahmed讨论了JAK投资的执行短缺（基于表3中25.50英镑的收盘价），Moore做出以下陈述：
"我知道市场走势是执行短缺的一个因素。由于市场走势超出Norsk的控制范围，在评估他的表现时，我们应该调整计算方法，只包括佣金成本和200股的错失交易机会。" /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 表1：11:15:08BDF限价订单簿 买单(Bid) 卖单(Ask) 经纪商 价格 数量 经纪商 价格 数量 C 15.42 800 B 15.48 1,800 B 15.38 2,000 A 15.50 1,000 A 15.36 500 C 15.52 600/nimage_2 ocr text: 表2：BDF买入交易执行情况 交易时间 交易数量 交易价格 卖价 卖单数量 买价 买单数量 11:15:09 1,500 15.46 15.48 1,500 15.38 2,000 12:20:30 500 15.50 15.50 1,000 15.36 500/nimage_3 ocr text: 表3：伦敦证券交易所部分交易信息 股票 日均成交量（ADV） 前一日最高价 前一日最低价 前一日收盘价 WWT 450,000 12.50 12.43 12.48 JAK 2,000,000 25.80 24.20 25.50</ocr>
question: BDF购买交易的股票量加权有效价差最接近：
translate_question: The weighted effective spread of stocks purchased by BDF is closest to:
translate_context:
Nadia Ahmed is the chief trader at Tweed Asset Management, London, UK. She is reviewing transaction requests received by the trading desk from individual and institutional portfolio managers and deciding what trading strategies to recommend.
Ahmed first reviews the transaction request from Tweed’s personal portfolio manager Edwin Moore. She forwarded the requests to Vladimir Norsk, a trader at the company. The first transaction Ahmed asked Norsk to execute was to buy 2,000 shares of BDF Limited, which was traded on SEAQ, a trader market that does not often trade stocks in London. Norsk viewed BDF's current limit order book, as shown in Table 1.
<image_1>
Norsk completed the BDF order on the same day by executing the transaction shown in Table 2.
<image_2>
Next Ahmed reviews a request from a customer who is very concerned about price execution to purchase 300,000 shares of WWT plc. She looked at the trading volumes of the previous day (Table 3) and prepared her trading recommendations.
<image_3>
Ahmed asked Norsk to execute Moore's last order to buy 1,000 shares of JAK plc at a limit of £25.00, with the order valid for the same day.

Norsk failed to complete the limit order on the first day and after consultation with the customer, they agreed to modify the price. Two days later, Norsk successfully purchased 800 shares of JAK for £26.25, with a commission cost of £135.00. When the stock closed at £26.75 on the day, Moore decided to cancel the order for the remaining 200 shares.

Moore and Ahmed discussed the execution shortage of JAK investments (based on the closing price of £25.50 in Table 3), and Moore made the following statement:
"I know that the market trend is a factor in the execution shortage. Since the market trend is beyond Norsk's control, when evaluating his performance, we should adjust the calculation method to include only commission costs and missed trading opportunities of 200 shares." /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Table 1: 11:15:08BDF Limit Order Book Buy Order (Bid) Sell Order (Ask) Broker Price Quantity Broker Price Quantity C 15.42 800 B 15.48 1,800 B 15.38 2,000 A 15.50 1,000 A 15.36 500 C 15.52 600/nimage_2 ocr text: Table 2: BDF Buy Transaction Execution Trading Time Quantity Trading Price Sell Price Quantity of sell orders Buy price Quantity of buy orders 11:15:09 1,500 15.46 15.48 1,500 15.38 2,000 12:20:30 500 15.50 15.50 15.50 15.36 500/nimage_3 ocr text: Table 3: Partial trading information of London Stock Exchange Stocks Average daily trading volume (ADV) Highest price on the previous day Lowest price on the previous day Close price on the previous day WWT 450,000 12.50 12.43 12.48 JAK 2,000,000 25.80 24.20 25.50</ocr>

context:
Brian O'Reilly 是田纳西州教师退休系统（Tennessee Teachers' Retirement System, TTRS）的资本市场顾问。O'Reilly 正在与 TTRS 董事会会面，以阐述其对下一年资本市场的预期。董事会成员 Kay Durden 向 O'Reilly 询问历史数据中存在数据测量偏差的可能性。O'Reilly 回应道：
部分基准指数存在生存偏差（survivorship bias）。例如，失败或合并公司的收益会从数据序列中剔除，从而导致报告收益出现向上偏差。这种偏差可能致使对未来指数收益的预期过于乐观。另一种偏差源于在缺乏市场交易数据时使用评估数据。对于相同资产，评估价值的波动性往往低于市场确定的价值。结果是，与真实相关性相比，计算得出的与其他资产的相关性绝对值往往向上偏差，而该资产的真实方差则向下偏差。
董事会成员 Arnold Brown 向 O'Reilly 询问在制定资本市场预期时使用高频（每日）数据的情况。O'Reilly 回答：“有时为获取所需时长的数据序列，必须使用每日数据。高频数据对变量间的不同步性更为敏感，因此往往会得出更高的相关性估计值。”
董事会成员 Harold Melson 提到，他最近阅读了一篇有关与做出准确且无偏差预测相关的心理陷阱的文章。他请 O'Reilly 向董事会介绍锚定陷阱（anchoring trap）和确认性证据陷阱（confirming evidence trap）。O'Reilly 给出如下解释：
锚定陷阱指预测易过度受过去灾难性或戏剧性事件记忆的影响，这些事件在人的记忆中根深蒂固。确认性证据陷阱是一种偏差，会使个人对支持其偏好观点的信息赋予比矛盾证据更大的权重。
董事会向 O'Reilly 询问使用多因素模型来估计资产收益及资产收益间协方差的情况。O'Reilly 展示了表 1 所示的全球股票和全球债券的因素协方差矩阵，以及表 2 所示的市场因素敏感性和残差风险。
<image_1>
最后，鉴于市盈率并非随时间恒定，且许多公司在回购股票而非增加现金股息，董事会询问如何预测主要市场的预期收益。O'Reilly 回应称，Grinold–Kroner 模型考虑了这些因素，然后对欧洲股票市场做出如下预测：
・股息率将为 1.95%。
・流通股数量将减少 1.00%。
・长期通货膨胀率将为每年 1.75%。
・市盈率倍数的扩张率将为每年 0.15%。
・长期公司盈利增长溢价将比 GDP 增长高出 1%。
・GDP 增长将为每年 2.5%。
・无风险利率将为 2.5%。 /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 展示1: 因子协方差矩阵 全球股票 全球债券 全球股票 0.0225 0.0022 全球债券 0.0022 0.0025 展示2： 市场因子敏感度和剩余风险 敏感度 剩余风险 全球股票 全球债券 市场1 1.20 0.00 12.00% 市场2 0.90 0.00 7.00% 市场3 0.00 0.95 1.80%</ocr>
question: 关于他对生存偏差的解释，O'Reilly 最有可能是：
options: B. 错误，因为生存偏差会导致对预期收益的看法过于悲观。
C. 错误，因为生存偏差会导致报告的收益出现向下偏差。
translate_question: Regarding his explanation of survival bias, O'Reilly is most likely:
translate_context:
Brian O'Reilly is a capital market consultant for the Tennessee Teachers' Retirement System (TTRS). O'Reilly is meeting with the TTRS board to articulate its expectations for the capital markets for the coming year. Board member Kay Durden asked O'Reilly about the possibility of data measurement bias in historical data. O'Reilly responded:
Some benchmark indices have survival bias. For example, the earnings of a failed or merged company are removed from the data sequence, resulting in an upward bias in reported earnings. This bias may lead to overly optimistic expectations of future index returns. Another bias stems from the use of evaluation data in the absence of market transaction data. For the same asset, the volatility of the assessed value is often lower than the value determined by the market. As a result, compared to the true correlation, the calculated absolute value of correlation with other assets tends to deviate upward, while the true variance of that asset is deviated downward.
Board member Arnold Brown asked O'Reilly about the use of high-frequency (daily) data when developing capital market expectations. O'Reilly answered: "Sometimes, daily data must be used to obtain data sequences of the required duration. High-frequency data is more sensitive to the asynchronousness between variables, so it is often possible to obtain higher correlation estimates."
Board member Harold Melson mentioned that he recently read an article about psychological traps related to making accurate and unbiased predictions. He asked O'Reilly to introduce the board to the anchoring trap and confirming evidence trap. O'Reilly gives the following explanation:
Anchoring traps refer to predictions that are prone to excessively affected by memories of past catastrophic or dramatic events that are deeply rooted in human memory. Confirmative evidence traps are biases that give individuals greater weight to information supporting their preferred views than contradictory evidence.
The board asked O'Reilly about the use of multifactorial models to estimate covariance between asset returns and asset returns. O'Reilly presents the factor covariance matrix for global stocks and global bonds shown in Table 1, and the market factor sensitivity and residual risk shown in Table 2.
<image_1>
Finally, given that the P/E ratio is not constant over time and that many companies are buying back stocks instead of increasing cash dividends, the board asks how to predict expected returns in major markets. O'Reilly responded that the Grinold–Kroner model took these factors into account and then made the following predictions for the European stock market:
・The dividend yield will be 1.95%.
・The number of outstanding shares will be reduced by 1.00%.
・The long-term inflation rate will be 1.75% per year.
・The expansion rate of the P/E multiple will be 0.15% per year.
・The long-term corporate earnings growth premium will be 1% higher than GDP growth.
・GDP growth will be 2.5% per year.
・The risk-free interest rate will be 2.5%. /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Show 1: Factor covariance matrix Global stocks Global bonds Global stocks 0.0225 0.0022 Global bonds 0.0022 0.0025 Show 2: Market Factor Sensitivity and Residual Risk Sensitivity Residual Risk Global stocks Global bonds Market 1 1.20 0.00 12.00% Market 2 0.90 0.00 7.00% Market 3 0.00 0.95 1.80%</ocr>

context:
Brian O'Reilly 是田纳西州教师退休系统（Tennessee Teachers' Retirement System, TTRS）的资本市场顾问。O'Reilly 正在与 TTRS 董事会会面，以阐述其对下一年资本市场的预期。董事会成员 Kay Durden 向 O'Reilly 询问历史数据中存在数据测量偏差的可能性。O'Reilly 回应道：
部分基准指数存在生存偏差（survivorship bias）。例如，失败或合并公司的收益会从数据序列中剔除，从而导致报告收益出现向上偏差。这种偏差可能致使对未来指数收益的预期过于乐观。另一种偏差源于在缺乏市场交易数据时使用评估数据。对于相同资产，评估价值的波动性往往低于市场确定的价值。结果是，与真实相关性相比，计算得出的与其他资产的相关性绝对值往往向上偏差，而该资产的真实方差则向下偏差。
董事会成员 Arnold Brown 向 O'Reilly 询问在制定资本市场预期时使用高频（每日）数据的情况。O'Reilly 回答：“有时为获取所需时长的数据序列，必须使用每日数据。高频数据对变量间的不同步性更为敏感，因此往往会得出更高的相关性估计值。”
董事会成员 Harold Melson 提到，他最近阅读了一篇有关与做出准确且无偏差预测相关的心理陷阱的文章。他请 O'Reilly 向董事会介绍锚定陷阱（anchoring trap）和确认性证据陷阱（confirming evidence trap）。O'Reilly 给出如下解释：
锚定陷阱指预测易过度受过去灾难性或戏剧性事件记忆的影响，这些事件在人的记忆中根深蒂固。确认性证据陷阱是一种偏差，会使个人对支持其偏好观点的信息赋予比矛盾证据更大的权重。
董事会向 O'Reilly 询问使用多因素模型来估计资产收益及资产收益间协方差的情况。O'Reilly 展示了表 1 所示的全球股票和全球债券的因素协方差矩阵，以及表 2 所示的市场因素敏感性和残差风险。
<image_1>
最后，鉴于市盈率并非随时间恒定，且许多公司在回购股票而非增加现金股息，董事会询问如何预测主要市场的预期收益。O'Reilly 回应称，Grinold–Kroner 模型考虑了这些因素，然后对欧洲股票市场做出如下预测：
・股息率将为 1.95%。
・流通股数量将减少 1.00%。
・长期通货膨胀率将为每年 1.75%。
・市盈率倍数的扩张率将为每年 0.15%。
・长期公司盈利增长溢价将比 GDP 增长高出 1%。
・GDP 增长将为每年 2.5%。
・无风险利率将为 2.5%。 /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 展示1: 因子协方差矩阵 全球股票 全球债券 全球股票 0.0225 0.0022 全球债券 0.0022 0.0025 展示2： 市场因子敏感度和剩余风险 敏感度 剩余风险 全球股票 全球债券 市场1 1.20 0.00 12.00% 市场2 0.90 0.00 7.00% 市场3 0.00 0.95 1.80%</ocr>
question: 关于他对评估数据偏差的解释，O'Reilly最有可能是
options: B. 错误，因为与其他资产计算得出的相关性绝对值往往向下偏差。
C. 错误，因为资产的真实方差向上偏差。
translate_question: Regarding his explanation of bias in assessing data, O'Reilly is most likely
translate_context:
Brian O'Reilly is a capital market consultant for the Tennessee Teachers' Retirement System (TTRS). O'Reilly is meeting with the TTRS board to articulate its expectations for the capital markets for the coming year. Board member Kay Durden asked O'Reilly about the possibility of data measurement bias in historical data. O'Reilly responded:
Some benchmark indices have survival bias. For example, the earnings of a failed or merged company are removed from the data sequence, resulting in an upward bias in reported earnings. This bias may lead to overly optimistic expectations of future index returns. Another bias stems from the use of evaluation data in the absence of market transaction data. For the same asset, the volatility of the assessed value is often lower than the value determined by the market. As a result, compared to the true correlation, the calculated absolute value of correlation with other assets tends to deviate upward, while the true variance of that asset is deviated downward.
Board member Arnold Brown asked O'Reilly about the use of high-frequency (daily) data when developing capital market expectations. O'Reilly answered: "Sometimes, daily data must be used to obtain data sequences of the required duration. High-frequency data is more sensitive to the asynchronousness between variables, so it is often possible to obtain higher correlation estimates."
Board member Harold Melson mentioned that he recently read an article about psychological traps related to making accurate and unbiased predictions. He asked O'Reilly to introduce the board to the anchoring trap and confirming evidence trap. O'Reilly gives the following explanation:
Anchoring traps refer to predictions that are prone to excessively affected by memories of past catastrophic or dramatic events that are deeply rooted in human memory. Confirmative evidence traps are biases that give individuals greater weight to information supporting their preferred views than contradictory evidence.
The board asked O'Reilly about the use of multifactorial models to estimate covariance between asset returns and asset returns. O'Reilly presents the factor covariance matrix for global stocks and global bonds shown in Table 1, and the market factor sensitivity and residual risk shown in Table 2.
<image_1>
Finally, given that the P/E ratio is not constant over time and that many companies are buying back stocks instead of increasing cash dividends, the board asks how to predict expected returns in major markets. O'Reilly responded that the Grinold–Kroner model took these factors into account and then made the following predictions for the European stock market:
・The dividend yield will be 1.95%.
・The number of outstanding shares will be reduced by 1.00%.
・The long-term inflation rate will be 1.75% per year.
・The expansion rate of the P/E multiple will be 0.15% per year.
・The long-term corporate earnings growth premium will be 1% higher than GDP growth.
・GDP growth will be 2.5% per year.
・The risk-free interest rate will be 2.5%. /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Show 1: Factor covariance matrix Global stocks Global bonds Global stocks 0.0225 0.0022 Global bonds 0.0022 0.0025 Show 2: Market Factor Sensitivity and Residual Risk Sensitivity Residual Risk Global stocks Global bonds Market 1 1.20 0.00 12.00% Market 2 0.90 0.00 7.00% Market 3 0.00 0.95 1.80%</ocr>

・无风险利率将为 2.5%。 /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 展示1: 因子协方差矩阵 全球股票 全球债券 全球股票 0.0225 0.0022 全球债券 0.0022 0.0025 展示2： 市场因子敏感度和剩余风险 敏感度 剩余风险 全球股票 全球债券 市场1 1.20 0.00 12.00% 市场2 0.90 0.00 7.00% 市场3 0.00 0.95 1.80%</ocr>
question: 根据表 1 和表 2 中的数据，市场 1 与市场 2 之间的协方差最接近：
translate_question: According to the data in Tables 1 and 2, the covariance between Market 1 and Market 2 is closest:
translate_context:
Brian O'Reilly is a capital market consultant for the Tennessee Teachers' Retirement System (TTRS). O'Reilly is meeting with the TTRS board to articulate its expectations for the capital markets for the coming year. Board member Kay Durden asked O'Reilly about the possibility of data measurement bias in historical data. O'Reilly responded:
Some benchmark indices have survival bias. For example, the earnings of a failed or merged company are removed from the data sequence, resulting in an upward bias in reported earnings. This bias may lead to overly optimistic expectations of future index returns. Another bias stems from the use of evaluation data in the absence of market transaction data. For the same asset, the volatility of the assessed value is often lower than the value determined by the market. As a result, compared to the true correlation, the calculated absolute value of correlation with other assets tends to deviate upward, while the true variance of that asset is deviated downward.
Board member Arnold Brown asked O'Reilly about the use of high-frequency (daily) data when developing capital market expectations. O'Reilly answered: "Sometimes, daily data must be used to obtain data sequences of the required duration. High-frequency data is more sensitive to the asynchronousness between variables, so it is often possible to obtain higher correlation estimates."
Board member Harold Melson mentioned that he recently read an article about psychological traps related to making accurate and unbiased predictions. He asked O'Reilly to introduce the board to the anchoring trap and confirming evidence trap. O'Reilly gives the following explanation:
Anchoring traps refer to predictions that are prone to excessively affected by memories of past catastrophic or dramatic events that are deeply rooted in human memory. Confirmative evidence traps are biases that give individuals greater weight to information supporting their preferred views than contradictory evidence.
The board asked O'Reilly about the use of multifactorial models to estimate covariance between asset returns and asset returns. O'Reilly presents the factor covariance matrix for global stocks and global bonds shown in Table 1, and the market factor sensitivity and residual risk shown in Table 2.
<image_1>
Finally, given that the P/E ratio is not constant over time and that many companies are buying back stocks instead of increasing cash dividends, the board asks how to predict expected returns in major markets. O'Reilly responded that the Grinold–Kroner model took these factors into account and then made the following predictions for the European stock market:
・The dividend yield will be 1.95%.
・The number of outstanding shares will be reduced by 1.00%.
・The long-term inflation rate will be 1.75% per year.
・The expansion rate of the P/E multiple will be 0.15% per year.
・The long-term corporate earnings growth premium will be 1% higher than GDP growth.
・GDP growth will be 2.5% per year.
・The risk-free interest rate will be 2.5%. /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Show 1: Factor covariance matrix Global stocks Global bonds Global stocks 0.0225 0.0022 Global bonds 0.0022 0.0025 Show 2: Market Factor Sensitivity and Residual Risk Sensitivity Residual Risk Global stocks Global bonds Market 1 1.20 0.00 12.00% Market 2 0.90 0.00 7.00% Market 3 0.00 0.95 1.80%</ocr>

context:
Brian O'Reilly 是田纳西州教师退休系统（Tennessee Teachers' Retirement System, TTRS）的资本市场顾问。O'Reilly 正在与 TTRS 董事会会面，以阐述其对下一年资本市场的预期。董事会成员 Kay Durden 向 O'Reilly 询问历史数据中存在数据测量偏差的可能性。O'Reilly 回应道：
部分基准指数存在生存偏差（survivorship bias）。例如，失败或合并公司的收益会从数据序列中剔除，从而导致报告收益出现向上偏差。这种偏差可能致使对未来指数收益的预期过于乐观。另一种偏差源于在缺乏市场交易数据时使用评估数据。对于相同资产，评估价值的波动性往往低于市场确定的价值。结果是，与真实相关性相比，计算得出的与其他资产的相关性绝对值往往向上偏差，而该资产的真实方差则向下偏差。
董事会成员 Arnold Brown 向 O'Reilly 询问在制定资本市场预期时使用高频（每日）数据的情况。O'Reilly 回答：“有时为获取所需时长的数据序列，必须使用每日数据。高频数据对变量间的不同步性更为敏感，因此往往会得出更高的相关性估计值。”
董事会成员 Harold Melson 提到，他最近阅读了一篇有关与做出准确且无偏差预测相关的心理陷阱的文章。他请 O'Reilly 向董事会介绍锚定陷阱（anchoring trap）和确认性证据陷阱（confirming evidence trap）。O'Reilly 给出如下解释：
锚定陷阱指预测易过度受过去灾难性或戏剧性事件记忆的影响，这些事件在人的记忆中根深蒂固。确认性证据陷阱是一种偏差，会使个人对支持其偏好观点的信息赋予比矛盾证据更大的权重。
董事会向 O'Reilly 询问使用多因素模型来估计资产收益及资产收益间协方差的情况。O'Reilly 展示了表 1 所示的全球股票和全球债券的因素协方差矩阵，以及表 2 所示的市场因素敏感性和残差风险。
<image_1>
最后，鉴于市盈率并非随时间恒定，且许多公司在回购股票而非增加现金股息，董事会询问如何预测主要市场的预期收益。O'Reilly 回应称，Grinold–Kroner 模型考虑了这些因素，然后对欧洲股票市场做出如下预测：
・股息率将为 1.95%。
・流通股数量将减少 1.00%。
・长期通货膨胀率将为每年 1.75%。
・市盈率倍数的扩张率将为每年 0.15%。
・长期公司盈利增长溢价将比 GDP 增长高出 1%。
・GDP 增长将为每年 2.5%。
・无风险利率将为 2.5%。 /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 展示1: 因子协方差矩阵 全球股票 全球债券 全球股票 0.0225 0.0022 全球债券 0.0022 0.0025 展示2： 市场因子敏感度和剩余风险 敏感度 剩余风险 全球股票 全球债券 市场1 1.20 0.00 12.00% 市场2 0.90 0.00 7.00% 市场3 0.00 0.95 1.80%</ocr>

context:
William Azarov是资产管理公司Westcome Investments的投资组合经理。Azarov正在筹备与Westcome的两位客户会面，并得到了初级分析师Jason Boulder的协助。第一场会面的对象是Maglav Inc.，这是一家快速发展的美国科技公司，员工队伍年轻且人员流动率高。Azarov指示Boulder审查Maglav公司固定收益（DB）养老金计划的细节。该计划资金充裕，管理的资产规模达2500万美元。Boulder提出以下两点观察：
观察1：Maglav的股东从该计划的资金充裕状态中受益。
观察2：如果员工流动率下降，Maglav养老金计划的资金比率将会降低。
Maglav将养老金计划的管理完全外包给了Westcome Investments。费用结构要求Maglav无论业绩如何，都要向Westcome支付高额的基本费用。Boulder告诉Azarov，外包为像Maglav养老金计划这样的小型机构投资者带来以下三项好处：
好处1：监管要求降低。
好处2：委托代理问题引发的利益冲突得以消除。
好处3：投资者通过规模效益能够接触到更广泛的投资策略。
在与Maglav的会面中，Azarov介绍了Westcome在管理养老金计划时所采用的投资方法。该方法的特点是对另类投资的配置比例较高、进行大量积极管理，并且依赖于将资产外包给其他外部资产管理公司。Azarov还解释说，Maglav的经营业绩与养老金资产回报的相关性较低，而且由于养老基金资产在Maglav市值中所占比例较小，这一事实也影响了投资策略。Azarov表示，该计划受1974年《雇员退休收入保障法》（ERISA）约束，并遵循公认会计原则，包括《会计准则编码》（ASC）715“薪酬——退休福利”。
Azarov的第二场会面是与Wolf University Endowment Fund（该基金）的首席投资官John Spintop。Spintop聘请Westcome协助制定一项新的投资政策，以提交给基金董事会。该基金管理的资产规模为2亿美元，总体目标是在为Wolf University提供必要财务支持的同时，维持长期购买力。在会面中，Spintop表示，该基金有一项年度支出政策，即向Wolf University支付基金三年滚动资产价值的4%，并且基金的风险承受能力应考虑以下三项负债特征：
特征1：该基金能够轻松进入债务市场。
特征2：该基金支持Wolf University年度预算的10%。
特征3：该基金每年从馈赠和捐赠中获得大量资金流入。
该基金的投资人员规模较小，在管理另类资产方面经验有限，目前采用挪威模式作为投资方法。Azarov建议改变投资方法，对外部管理的另类资产（即对冲基金和私募股权）进行配置。各类资产类别的十年名义预期回报假设，以及三项包括对另类资产部分配置的拟议资产配置方案，列示于表1。
<image_1>
预计未来10年的年通货膨胀率为2.5%。  /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 图表1：10年名义预期回报假设与建议配置 资产类别 预期回报率 配置1 配置2 配置3 美国国债 4.1% 45% 10% 13% 美国股票 6.3% 40% 15% 32% 非美国股票 7.5% 10% 15% 40% 对冲基金 5.0% 0% 30% 5% 私募股权 9.1%  5% 30% 10%</ocr>
question: 关于 Maglav 养老金计划，Boulder 的哪项观察是正确的？
options: C. 观察 1 和观察 2 都对
translate_question: Which observation of Boulder is correct about Maglav pension plan?
translate_context:
William Azarov is a portfolio manager at Westcome Investments, an asset management firm. Azarov is preparing to meet with two Westcome clients and has been assisted by junior analyst Jason Boulder. The first meeting was Maglav Inc., a fast-growing American technology company with a young workforce and high turnover. Azarov directed Boulder to review details of Maglav's fixed income (DB) pension plan. The program is well funded and manages assets of $25 million. Boulder puts forward the following two observations:
Observation 1: Maglav shareholders benefit from the program’s abundant funding state.
Observation 2: If employee turnover drops, the funding ratio of Maglav pension plan will be reduced.
Maglav completely outsourced the management of pension plans to Westcome Investments. The fee structure requires Maglav to pay Westcome a high basic fee regardless of its performance. Boulder told Azarov that outsourcing brings these three benefits to small institutional investors like the Maglav Pension Plan:
Benefit 1: Reduced regulatory requirements.
Benefit 2: The conflict of interest caused by the agency issue is eliminated.
Benefit 3: Investors can access a wider range of investment strategies through economies of scale.
During a meeting with Maglav, Azarov introduced the investment approach Westcom has adopted when managing pension plans. This method is characterized by a high allocation ratio for alternative investments, a large amount of active management, and reliance on outsourcing assets to other external asset management companies. Azarov also explained that Maglav's operating performance is less correlated with return on pension assets, and that the fact that pension fund assets account for a small proportion of Maglav's market capitalization also affects investment strategies. Azarov said the plan was subject to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) and was subject to GAAP, including Accounting Standards Code (ASC) 715 "Salary - Retirement Benefits".
Azarov's second meeting was with John Spintop, chief investment officer of Wolf University Endowment Fund. Spintop hired Westcome to assist in the development of a new investment policy to submit it to the fund's board of directors. The fund manages assets of $200 million, with the overall goal of maintaining long-term purchasing power while providing the necessary financial support to Wolf University. During the meeting, Spintop said the fund had an annual expenditure policy, which was to pay Wolf University 4% of the fund's three-year rolling asset value, and that the fund's risk tolerance should take into account the following three liability characteristics:
Feature 1: The fund can easily enter the debt market.
Feature 2: The fund supports 10% of Wolf University’s annual budget.
Feature 3: The fund receives a large amount of inflows from gifts and donations every year.
The fund has a small investment staff and limited experience in managing alternative assets. It currently adopts the Norwegian model as its investment method. Azarov recommends changing investment methods to allocate externally managed alternative assets (i.e. hedge funds and private equity). The ten-year nominal expected return assumptions for various asset classes, and three proposed asset allocation plans including partial allocation of alternative assets, are listed in Table 1.
<image_1>
The annual inflation rate is expected to be 2.5% over the next 10 years.  /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Chart 1: 10-year nominal expected return assumptions and recommended allocations Asset category Expected return allocations 1 Configuration 2 Configuration 3 U.S. Treasury 4.1% 45% 10% 13% U.S. stocks 6.3% 40% 15% 32% Non-U.S. stocks 7.5% 10% 15% 40% Hedge funds 5.0% 0% 30% 5% Private equity 9.1% 5% 30% 10%</ocr>

context:
William Azarov是资产管理公司Westcome Investments的投资组合经理。Azarov正在筹备与Westcome的两位客户会面，并得到了初级分析师Jason Boulder的协助。第一场会面的对象是Maglav Inc.，这是一家快速发展的美国科技公司，员工队伍年轻且人员流动率高。Azarov指示Boulder审查Maglav公司固定收益（DB）养老金计划的细节。该计划资金充裕，管理的资产规模达2500万美元。Boulder提出以下两点观察：
观察1：Maglav的股东从该计划的资金充裕状态中受益。
观察2：如果员工流动率下降，Maglav养老金计划的资金比率将会降低。
Maglav将养老金计划的管理完全外包给了Westcome Investments。费用结构要求Maglav无论业绩如何，都要向Westcome支付高额的基本费用。Boulder告诉Azarov，外包为像Maglav养老金计划这样的小型机构投资者带来以下三项好处：
好处1：监管要求降低。
好处2：委托代理问题引发的利益冲突得以消除。
好处3：投资者通过规模效益能够接触到更广泛的投资策略。
在与Maglav的会面中，Azarov介绍了Westcome在管理养老金计划时所采用的投资方法。该方法的特点是对另类投资的配置比例较高、进行大量积极管理，并且依赖于将资产外包给其他外部资产管理公司。Azarov还解释说，Maglav的经营业绩与养老金资产回报的相关性较低，而且由于养老基金资产在Maglav市值中所占比例较小，这一事实也影响了投资策略。Azarov表示，该计划受1974年《雇员退休收入保障法》（ERISA）约束，并遵循公认会计原则，包括《会计准则编码》（ASC）715“薪酬——退休福利”。
Azarov的第二场会面是与Wolf University Endowment Fund（该基金）的首席投资官John Spintop。Spintop聘请Westcome协助制定一项新的投资政策，以提交给基金董事会。该基金管理的资产规模为2亿美元，总体目标是在为Wolf University提供必要财务支持的同时，维持长期购买力。在会面中，Spintop表示，该基金有一项年度支出政策，即向Wolf University支付基金三年滚动资产价值的4%，并且基金的风险承受能力应考虑以下三项负债特征：
特征1：该基金能够轻松进入债务市场。
特征2：该基金支持Wolf University年度预算的10%。
特征3：该基金每年从馈赠和捐赠中获得大量资金流入。
该基金的投资人员规模较小，在管理另类资产方面经验有限，目前采用挪威模式作为投资方法。Azarov建议改变投资方法，对外部管理的另类资产（即对冲基金和私募股权）进行配置。各类资产类别的十年名义预期回报假设，以及三项包括对另类资产部分配置的拟议资产配置方案，列示于表1。
<image_1>
预计未来10年的年通货膨胀率为2.5%。  /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 图表1：10年名义预期回报假设与建议配置 资产类别 预期回报率 配置1 配置2 配置3 美国国债 4.1% 45% 10% 13% 美国股票 6.3% 40% 15% 32% 非美国股票 7.5% 10% 15% 40% 对冲基金 5.0% 0% 30% 5% 私募股权 9.1%  5% 30% 10%</ocr>
question: Westcome 对 Maglav 养老金计划的投资策略可以最准确地描述为：
translate_question: Westcome's investment strategy for Maglav pension plans can be described most accurately as:
translate_context:
William Azarov is a portfolio manager at Westcome Investments, an asset management firm. Azarov is preparing to meet with two Westcome clients and has been assisted by junior analyst Jason Boulder. The first meeting was Maglav Inc., a fast-growing American technology company with a young workforce and high turnover. Azarov directed Boulder to review details of Maglav's fixed income (DB) pension plan. The program is well funded and manages assets of $25 million. Boulder puts forward the following two observations:
Observation 1: Maglav shareholders benefit from the program’s abundant funding state.
Observation 2: If employee turnover drops, the funding ratio of Maglav pension plan will be reduced.
Maglav completely outsourced the management of pension plans to Westcome Investments. The fee structure requires Maglav to pay Westcome a high basic fee regardless of its performance. Boulder told Azarov that outsourcing brings these three benefits to small institutional investors like the Maglav Pension Plan:
Benefit 1: Reduced regulatory requirements.
Benefit 2: The conflict of interest caused by the agency issue is eliminated.
Benefit 3: Investors can access a wider range of investment strategies through economies of scale.
During a meeting with Maglav, Azarov introduced the investment approach Westcom has adopted when managing pension plans. This method is characterized by a high allocation ratio for alternative investments, a large amount of active management, and reliance on outsourcing assets to other external asset management companies. Azarov also explained that Maglav's operating performance is less correlated with return on pension assets, and that the fact that pension fund assets account for a small proportion of Maglav's market capitalization also affects investment strategies. Azarov said the plan was subject to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) and was subject to GAAP, including Accounting Standards Code (ASC) 715 "Salary - Retirement Benefits".
Azarov's second meeting was with John Spintop, chief investment officer of Wolf University Endowment Fund. Spintop hired Westcome to assist in the development of a new investment policy to submit it to the fund's board of directors. The fund manages assets of $200 million, with the overall goal of maintaining long-term purchasing power while providing the necessary financial support to Wolf University. During the meeting, Spintop said the fund had an annual expenditure policy, which was to pay Wolf University 4% of the fund's three-year rolling asset value, and that the fund's risk tolerance should take into account the following three liability characteristics:
Feature 1: The fund can easily enter the debt market.
Feature 2: The fund supports 10% of Wolf University’s annual budget.
Feature 3: The fund receives a large amount of inflows from gifts and donations every year.
The fund has a small investment staff and limited experience in managing alternative assets. It currently adopts the Norwegian model as its investment method. Azarov recommends changing investment methods to allocate externally managed alternative assets (i.e. hedge funds and private equity). The ten-year nominal expected return assumptions for various asset classes, and three proposed asset allocation plans including partial allocation of alternative assets, are listed in Table 1.
<image_1>
The annual inflation rate is expected to be 2.5% over the next 10 years.  /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Chart 1: 10-year nominal expected return assumptions and recommended allocations Asset category Expected return allocations 1 Configuration 2 Configuration 3 U.S. Treasury 4.1% 45% 10% 13% U.S. stocks 6.3% 40% 15% 32% Non-U.S. stocks 7.5% 10% 15% 40% Hedge funds 5.0% 0% 30% 5% Private equity 9.1% 5% 30% 10%</ocr>

question: 根据 Azarov 关于 ERISA 和 ASC 715 的声明，以下哪项陈述是正确的？
options: A. Maglav 不允许终止该计划

在与Maglav的会面中，Azarov介绍了Westcome在管理养老金计划时所采用的投资方法。该方法的特点是对另类投资的配置比例较高、进行大量积极管理，并且依赖于将资产外包给其他外部资产管理公司。Azarov还解释说，Maglav的经营业绩与养老金资产回报的相关性较低，而且由于养老基金资产在Maglav市值中所占比例较小，这一事实也影响了投资策略。Azarov表示，该计划受1974年《雇员退休收入保障法》（ERISA）约束，并遵循公认会计原则，包括《会计准则编码》（ASC）715“薪酬——退休福利”。
Azarov的第二场会面是与Wolf University Endowment Fund（该基金）的首席投资官John Spintop。Spintop聘请Westcome协助制定一项新的投资政策，以提交给基金董事会。该基金管理的资产规模为2亿美元，总体目标是在为Wolf University提供必要财务支持的同时，维持长期购买力。在会面中，Spintop表示，该基金有一项年度支出政策，即向Wolf University支付基金三年滚动资产价值的4%，并且基金的风险承受能力应考虑以下三项负债特征：
特征1：该基金能够轻松进入债务市场。
特征2：该基金支持Wolf University年度预算的10%。
特征3：该基金每年从馈赠和捐赠中获得大量资金流入。
该基金的投资人员规模较小，在管理另类资产方面经验有限，目前采用挪威模式作为投资方法。Azarov建议改变投资方法，对外部管理的另类资产（即对冲基金和私募股权）进行配置。各类资产类别的十年名义预期回报假设，以及三项包括对另类资产部分配置的拟议资产配置方案，列示于表1。
<image_1>
预计未来10年的年通货膨胀率为2.5%。  /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 图表1：10年名义预期回报假设与建议配置 资产类别 预期回报率 配置1 配置2 配置3 美国国债 4.1% 45% 10% 13% 美国股票 6.3% 40% 15% 32% 非美国股票 7.5% 10% 15% 40% 对冲基金 5.0% 0% 30% 5% 私募股权 9.1%  5% 30% 10%</ocr>
question: 鉴于基金的特点，展品 1 中哪个提议的资产配置最为合适？
translate_question: Given the characteristics of the fund, which proposed asset allocation in Exhibit 1 is the most suitable?
translate_context:
William Azarov is a portfolio manager at Westcome Investments, an asset management firm. Azarov is preparing to meet with two Westcome clients and has been assisted by junior analyst Jason Boulder. The first meeting was Maglav Inc., a fast-growing American technology company with a young workforce and high turnover. Azarov directed Boulder to review details of Maglav's fixed income (DB) pension plan. The program is well funded and manages assets of $25 million. Boulder puts forward the following two observations:
Observation 1: Maglav shareholders benefit from the program’s abundant funding state.
Observation 2: If employee turnover drops, the funding ratio of Maglav pension plan will be reduced.
Maglav completely outsourced the management of pension plans to Westcome Investments. The fee structure requires Maglav to pay Westcome a high basic fee regardless of its performance. Boulder told Azarov that outsourcing brings these three benefits to small institutional investors like the Maglav Pension Plan:
Benefit 1: Reduced regulatory requirements.
Benefit 2: The conflict of interest caused by the agency issue is eliminated.
Benefit 3: Investors can access a wider range of investment strategies through economies of scale.
During a meeting with Maglav, Azarov introduced the investment approach Westcom has adopted when managing pension plans. This method is characterized by a high allocation ratio for alternative investments, a large amount of active management, and reliance on outsourcing assets to other external asset management companies. Azarov also explained that Maglav's operating performance is less correlated with return on pension assets, and that the fact that pension fund assets account for a small proportion of Maglav's market capitalization also affects investment strategies. Azarov said the plan was subject to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) and was subject to GAAP, including Accounting Standards Code (ASC) 715 "Salary - Retirement Benefits".
Azarov's second meeting was with John Spintop, chief investment officer of Wolf University Endowment Fund. Spintop hired Westcome to assist in the development of a new investment policy to submit it to the fund's board of directors. The fund manages assets of $200 million, with the overall goal of maintaining long-term purchasing power while providing the necessary financial support to Wolf University. During the meeting, Spintop said the fund had an annual expenditure policy, which was to pay Wolf University 4% of the fund's three-year rolling asset value, and that the fund's risk tolerance should take into account the following three liability characteristics:
Feature 1: The fund can easily enter the debt market.
Feature 2: The fund supports 10% of Wolf University’s annual budget.
Feature 3: The fund receives a large amount of inflows from gifts and donations every year.
The fund has a small investment staff and limited experience in managing alternative assets. It currently adopts the Norwegian model as its investment method. Azarov recommends changing investment methods to allocate externally managed alternative assets (i.e. hedge funds and private equity). The ten-year nominal expected return assumptions for various asset classes, and three proposed asset allocation plans including partial allocation of alternative assets, are listed in Table 1.
<image_1>
The annual inflation rate is expected to be 2.5% over the next 10 years.  /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Chart 1: 10-year nominal expected return assumptions and recommended allocations Asset category Expected return allocations 1 Configuration 2 Configuration 3 U.S. Treasury 4.1% 45% 10% 13% U.S. stocks 6.3% 40% 15% 32% Non-U.S. stocks 7.5% 10% 15% 40% Hedge funds 5.0% 0% 30% 5% Private equity 9.1% 5% 30% 10%</ocr>

Summer 正在审查每只基金的收费安排，他担心基金经理为了赚取更高的费用而有承担过度风险的动机。表 1 展示了这三只基金的收费安排。

The Tree Fallers Endowment Fund plans to allocate a portion of its portfolio to alternative investment funds. The endowment hires Kurt Summer, a consultant at Summer Brothers Consultants, to select the right alternative investment funds for their portfolio. Summer has identified three funds with investment potential and will present the performance of these investments to the board of directors at the next quarterly meeting of the endowment fund board.
Summer is reviewing the fee arrangements for each fund, and he is concerned that fund managers are motivated to take excessive risk in order to earn higher fees. Table 1 shows the charging arrangements for these three funds.

context:

Summer 正在审查每只基金的收费安排，他担心基金经理为了赚取更高的费用而有承担过度风险的动机。表 1 展示了这三只基金的收费安排。

context:
Olli Nava是环球基金资产管理公司（Globofunds Asset Management）的初级经济学家，这是一家大型投资管理公司。她被要求为公司规模最大的基金——多元绝对收益策略基金（Diversified Absolute Return Strategies Fund，DARS）相关的多个不同市场的资产类别生成资本市场预期。

Olli Nava知道，在环球基金，长期国内生产总值（GDP）趋势预测被视为形成资本市场预期的起点，但她不确定为何如此。她向同事Jedd Wiggins请教，为何在预测资产类别回报时，长期趋势GDP增长被认为至关重要。Wiggins发表了以下两点论述：
 - 论述1：理论与实证均支持，实际政府债券收益率的平均水平与经济的趋势增长率存在因果关联。
 - 论述2：从长期来看，股票市场的总回报与GDP增长率存在因果联系。

为预测国内经济的趋势GDP增长，Olli Nava整理了图1所示的环球基金资产管理公司数据。
<image_1>

Olli Nava认为，全球化程度的提升将使经常账户在各经济体增长率中发挥更重要的作用。她研究了基金所涉三个主要经济体之间的宏观经济关联。与这些经济体相关的宏观经济数据如图2所示。
<image_2>

Olli Nava还认为，外汇波动是DARS中期表现的关键决定因素。她研究了基金所涉三个主要发展中市场的宏观经济政策，并整理了图3所示的数据。
<image_3>

Olli Nava试图预测可能影响基金的外汇汇率走势。她留意到最大的外汇敞口在X国。基金本国货币（DOM）与X国货币（FOR）的当前即期汇率为DOM/FOR = 1.3020。国内与国外市场预期回报的相关数据见图4。
<image_4>

Olli Nava还将购买力平价视作长期外汇汇率预测的工具。她注意到本国的预期通胀率高于X国的预期通胀率。  /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 图1：关于国内经济的信息 指标 数据 年劳动投入增长 0.8% 年劳动生产率增长 1.2% 年通货膨胀率 2.5% 股息收益率 3.0% 利润占GDP比例的长期变化 0% 市盈率（P/E倍数）的长期变化 0%/nimage_2 ocr text: 图2：与三个经济体相关的宏观经济数据 经济体 储蓄 投资 税收 政府支出 1 增加 减少 增加 减少 2 增加 减少 增加 3 增加 增加 增加 增加/nimage_3 ocr text: 图3：与三个发展中国家市场相关的宏观经济数据 发展中市场 资本流动 汇率 A 受限制 固定汇率 B 不受限制 固定汇率 C 不受限制 浮动汇率/nimage_4 ocr text: 图4：国内市场和外国×国的预期回报率 回报类型 国内市场 国外X国 短期利率 0.75% 1.25% 期限溢价 0.00% 0.50% 信用溢价 1.10% 0.60% 股票溢价 3.00% 4.00% 流动性溢价 0.00% 0.00%</ocr>
question: Wiggins 所做的陈述中有多少条是准确的？
translate_question: How many of the statements Wiggins made are accurate?
translate_context:
Olli Nava is a junior economist at Globofunds Asset Management, a large investment management company. She was asked to generate capital market expectations for asset classes in multiple different markets related to the company's largest fund, the Diversified Absolute Return Strategies Fund (DARS).

Olli Nava knows that at Global Fund, long-term gross domestic product (GDP) trend forecasts are seen as the starting point for forming capital market expectations, but she is not sure why. She asked colleague Jedd Wiggins why long-term trending GDP growth is considered crucial when predicting asset class returns. Wiggins has made the following two statements:
 - Discussion 1: Both theory and empirical support, there is a causal correlation between the average level of actual government bond yields and the trend growth rate of the economy.
 - Discussion 2: In the long run, there is a causal relationship between the total return of the stock market and the GDP growth rate.

To predict trend GDP growth in the domestic economy, Olli Nava compiled the data of Global Fund Asset Management in Figure 1.
<image_1>

Olli Nava believes that the increase in globalization will allow the current account to play a more important role in the growth rate of various economies. She examined the macroeconomic linkages between the three major economies involved in the fund. The macroeconomic data related to these economies are shown in Figure 2.
<image_2>

Olli Nava also believes that foreign exchange volatility is a key determinant of DARS's mid-term performance. She studied macroeconomic policies in three major developing markets involved in the fund and compiled the data shown in Figure 3.
<image_3>

Olli Nava tries to predict the foreign exchange rate trend that could affect the fund. She noticed that the largest foreign exchange exposure was in Country X. The current spot exchange rate of the fund's domestic currency (DOM) and the country X currency (FOR) is DOM/FOR = 1.3020. Relevant data on expected returns in domestic and foreign markets are shown in Figure 4.
<image_4>

Olli Nava also regards purchasing power parity as a tool for long-term foreign exchange rate forecasting. She noticed that the expected inflation rate in her country was higher than that in Country X.  /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Figure 1: Information about the domestic economy Indicator Data Annual labor input growth 0.8% Annual labor productivity growth 1.2% Annual inflation 2.5% Dividend yield 3.0% Long-term change in the proportion of profit to GDP 0% Long-term change in the price-to-earnings ratio (P/E multiple) 0%/nimage_2 ocr text: Figure 2: Macroeconomic data related to the three economies Economy Savings Investment Taxes Government expenditure 1 Increase Decrease Increase Decrease 2 Increase Decrease 3 Increase Increase Increase Increase/nimage_3 ocr text: Figure 3: Macroeconomic data related to the three developing markets Developing market Capital flow Exchange rate A Restricted Fixed exchange rate B Unrestricted Fixed exchange rate C Unrestricted Floating exchange rate/nimage_4 ocr text: Figure 4: Expected rate of return for domestic market and foreign countries Return type Domestic market Foreign countries Short-term interest rate 0.75% 1.25% Term premium 0.00% 0.50% Credit premium 1.10% 0.60% Stock premium 3.00% 4.00% Liquidity premium 0.00% 0.00%</ocr>

context:
Olli Nava是环球基金资产管理公司（Globofunds Asset Management）的初级经济学家，这是一家大型投资管理公司。她被要求为公司规模最大的基金——多元绝对收益策略基金（Diversified Absolute Return Strategies Fund，DARS）相关的多个不同市场的资产类别生成资本市场预期。

Olli Nava知道，在环球基金，长期国内生产总值（GDP）趋势预测被视为形成资本市场预期的起点，但她不确定为何如此。她向同事Jedd Wiggins请教，为何在预测资产类别回报时，长期趋势GDP增长被认为至关重要。Wiggins发表了以下两点论述：
 - 论述1：理论与实证均支持，实际政府债券收益率的平均水平与经济的趋势增长率存在因果关联。
 - 论述2：从长期来看，股票市场的总回报与GDP增长率存在因果联系。

为预测国内经济的趋势GDP增长，Olli Nava整理了图1所示的环球基金资产管理公司数据。
<image_1>

Olli Nava认为，全球化程度的提升将使经常账户在各经济体增长率中发挥更重要的作用。她研究了基金所涉三个主要经济体之间的宏观经济关联。与这些经济体相关的宏观经济数据如图2所示。
<image_2>

Olli Nava还认为，外汇波动是DARS中期表现的关键决定因素。她研究了基金所涉三个主要发展中市场的宏观经济政策，并整理了图3所示的数据。
<image_3>

translate_context:
Olli Nava is a junior economist at Globofunds Asset Management, a large investment management company. She was asked to generate capital market expectations for asset classes in multiple different markets related to the company's largest fund, the Diversified Absolute Return Strategies Fund (DARS).

Olli Nava knows that at Global Fund, long-term gross domestic product (GDP) trend forecasts are seen as the starting point for forming capital market expectations, but she is not sure why. She asked colleague Jedd Wiggins why long-term trending GDP growth is considered crucial when predicting asset class returns. Wiggins has made the following two statements:
 - Discussion 1: Both theory and empirical support, there is a causal correlation between the average level of actual government bond yields and the trend growth rate of the economy.
 - Discussion 2: In the long run, there is a causal relationship between the total return of the stock market and the GDP growth rate.

To predict trend GDP growth in the domestic economy, Olli Nava compiled the data of Global Fund Asset Management in Figure 1.
<image_1>

Olli Nava believes that the increase in globalization will allow the current account to play a more important role in the growth rate of various economies. She examined the macroeconomic linkages between the three major economies involved in the fund. The macroeconomic data related to these economies are shown in Figure 2.
<image_2>

Olli Nava also believes that foreign exchange volatility is a key determinant of DARS's mid-term performance. She studied macroeconomic policies in three major developing markets involved in the fund and compiled the data shown in Figure 3.
<image_3>

Olli Nava tries to predict the foreign exchange rate trend that could affect the fund. She noticed that the largest foreign exchange exposure was in Country X. The current spot exchange rate of the fund's domestic currency (DOM) and the country X currency (FOR) is DOM/FOR = 1.3020. Relevant data on expected returns in domestic and foreign markets are shown in Figure 4.
<image_4>

context:
Earl Warren是一位投资策略师，为一家跨资产类别及全球市场进行投资的投资公司制定资本市场预期。Warren的经济预测方法是将结构模型与扩散指数结合使用，以判定一个国家商业周期的当前阶段。Warren还会依据A国和B国（均为发达市场）以及C国（发展中市场）的历史增长率，来确定是否需要对其最初对各国总体经济增长趋势的预估进行调整。表1总结了Warren的预测：
<image_1>
随后，Warren探讨了投资新兴市场股票的各类风险，并表示：“在投资该市场之前，我们会尝试找出可能产生最强大影响力的因素，并评估它们的相对强度。” 以下是取自CEIC数据库的印度各项经济指标，用于阐释各类因素对汇率的影响：
<image_2>
讨论过后，Warren对货币政策与财政政策对收益率曲线的影响进行了专业阐释。关于它们对收益率曲线和经济环境的综合影响，他做出了以下陈述：
陈述1：如果货币政策是扩张性的，而财政政策是紧缩性的，收益率曲线会适度陡峭，经济影响则不太明确。
陈述2：如果货币政策和财政政策均为扩张性的，收益率曲线会陡峭，经济很可能会扩张。
陈述3：如果货币政策是紧缩性的，而财政政策是扩张性的，收益率曲线会适度倒挂，经济影响不太明确。
Warren正在考虑为其聚焦国际市场的固定收益投资组合增添三种新证券。他收集到了以下信息：

question: 沃伦最有可能对以下哪个国家的未来增长趋势预估做出重大调整？
translate_question: Warren is most likely to make major adjustments to which of the following countries’ future growth trend estimates?
translate_context:
Earl Warren is an investment strategist who sets capital market expectations for an investment company that invests across asset classes and global markets. Warren's approach to economic forecasting is to use structural models in combination with diffusion indexes to determine the current stage of a country's business cycle. Warren will also determine whether the initial adjustments to the overall economic growth trends of countries A and B (both developed markets) and C (developing markets). Table 1 summarizes Warren's predictions:
<image_1>
Warren then explored the various risks of investing in emerging market stocks and said: "Before investing in this market, we will try to identify the factors that may have the strongest influence and evaluate their relative strength." Here are various economic indicators from the CEIC database to illustrate the impact of various factors on exchange rates:
<image_2>
After the discussion, Warren gave a professional explanation of the impact of monetary policy and fiscal policy on the yield curve. Regarding their combined impact on the yield curve and economic environment, he made the following statement:
Statement 1: If monetary policy is expansionary and fiscal policy is tight, the yield curve will be moderately steep and the economic impact will be less clear.
Statement 2: If both monetary and fiscal policies are expansionary, the yield curve will be steep and the economy will likely expand.
Statement 3: If monetary policy is austerity and fiscal policy is expansionary, the yield curve will be moderately inverted and the economic impact is not very clear.

<image_1>
随后，Warren探讨了投资新兴市场股票的各类风险，并表示：“在投资该市场之前，我们会尝试找出可能产生最强大影响力的因素，并评估它们的相对强度。” 以下是取自CEIC数据库的印度各项经济指标，用于阐释各类因素对汇率的影响：

context:
Robert Waterman和Sophia Chen是美国投资公司Simon Fraser Analytics的投资组合经理。Waterman和Chen正在考虑投资美国和英国债券。他们考虑了各种收益率曲线策略和其他策略。表1显示了他们从美国和英国市场的流动性政府债券中收集的数据。
<image_1>

他们都对以下策略感兴趣：

1. 未来一年的收益率曲线骑乘策略
2. 通过购买凸性来做多或做空英国政府债券的看涨和/或看跌期权
3. 在美国和英国3年期债券之间进行套息交易

Waterman和Chen考虑购买一家挪威BeeBalm制造公司发行的债券。表2显示了他们的预期。
<image_2>

根据他们对市场的预期，他们决定在投资BeeBalm债券后用一年期远期合约对冲挪威克朗（NOK）的货币风险。然而，他们发现市场已变得不活跃，导致交易成本较高。由于瑞典克朗（SEK）的远期市场更为活跃，他们决定通过卖出SEK远期合约买入美元来构建交叉对冲。

最后，Waterman和Chen考虑购买一支BB级美国公司债券，该债券的久期为3.5年，收益率为3.7%。虽然他们对信用利差的最佳测量方法存在分歧，但都认同其信用状况将会改善，利差会收窄。
• Waterman表示我们可以使用表1来计算该美国债券的政府利差（G-spread），即3.64%
• Chen认为互换利差（I-spread）更好，因为它基于掉期固定利率，信用风险更低
• Chen也承认G-spread有其优势，因为它代表了我们在对冲利率风险后预期可以获得的回报

 /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: 表1政府债券收益率 期限(年) 美国 (%) 英国(%) 0.9 0.5% 1.00% 1.9 0.8% 1.70% 3.0 1.00% 2.00% 4.1 1.10% 2.10% 4.9 1.20% 2.20% 5.8 1.25% 2.25%/nimage_2 ocr text: 表2BeeBalm制造公司债券数据 数据描述 数据(%) 挪威的无风险利率 2.8% 美国的无风险利率 0.50% BeeBalm债券在挪威克朗（NOK）中的回报率 7.00% 挪威克朗相对于美元的预期变化 -0.40%</ocr>
question: 根据所提供的数据，关于"收益率曲线骑乘"策略，下列哪种说法更准确？
options: A. 假设收益率曲线水平会发生变化
B. 在英国市场实施比在美国市场更为有效
C. 在美国收益率曲线环境下无法实施
translate_question: Based on the data provided, which of the following statements is more accurate regarding the "yield curve riding" strategy?
translate_context:
Robert Waterman and Sophia Chen are portfolio managers at US investment firm Simon Fraser Analytics. Waterman and Chen are considering investing in U.S. and UK bonds. They considered various yield curve strategies and other strategies. Table 1 shows the data they collected from liquid government bonds in the U.S. and UK markets.
<image_1>

They are all interested in the following strategies:

1. Ride strategy for yield curve in the next year
2. Bull and/or put options for long or short UK government bonds by buying convexity
3. Arbitrage transactions between US and UK 3-year bonds

Waterman and Chen are considering buying bonds issued by a Norwegian BeeBalm manufacturing company. Table 2 shows their expectations.
<image_2>

Based on their expectations of the market, they decided to hedge the currency risk of Norwegian kroner (NOK) with one-year forward contracts after investing in BeeBalm bonds. However, they found that the market had become inactive, resulting in higher transaction costs. As the forward market of the Swedish Krona (SEK) is more active, they decided to build a cross hedge by selling SEK forward contracts to buy USD.

Finally, Waterman and Chen considered buying a BB grade U.S. corporate bond that has a duration of 3.5 years and a yield of 3.7%. Although they have differences on the best way to measure credit spreads, they all agree that their credit profile will improve and spreads will narrow.
• Waterman said we can use Table 1 to calculate the government spread for this U.S. bond, i.e. 3.64%.
• Chen believes that the swap spread (I-spread) is better because it is based on a fixed swap rate and has lower credit risk
• Chen also acknowledges that G-spread has its advantages because it represents the returns we expect to get after hedging interest rate risks.

 /n <ocr>image_1 ocr text: Table 1 Government bond yield Maturity (years) United States (%) United Kingdom (%) 0.9 0.5% 1.00% 1.9 0.8% 1.70% 3.0 1.00% 2.00% 4.1 1.10% 2.10% 4.9 1.20% 2.20% 5.8 1.25% 2.25%/nimage_2 ocr text: Table 2BeeBalm Manufacturing Corporate Bond Data Description Data (%) Norway's Risk-free Interest Rate 2.8% United States Risk-free Interest Rate 0.50% Return on BeeBalm Bonds in Norwegian Krone (NOK) 7.00% Expected Changes in Norwegian Krone relative to the US dollar -0.40%</ocr>

options: A. 提高投资组合的收益率
